elements.title: Francis of Delirium (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Francis of Delirium (pictured) overcame Luxembourg's relatively quiet alternative music scene to become a prominent artist?

elements.title: Cistern of Pulcheria (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Cistern of Pulcheria is one of the best-conserved Byzantine reservoirs in Istanbul?

elements.title: Saint Tarbula of Persia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Saint Tarbula of Persia was martyred by being cut in half by a saw after being accused of witchcraft?

elements.title: It Sticks Out Half a Mile (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that It Sticks Out Half a Mile is a radio sequel series to Dad's Army that follows three of the main characters in their attempts to renovate a seaside pier in post-war Britain?

elements.title: First Shift (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Uwe Boll has described his 2024 crime drama film First Shift as the least violent in his body of work?

elements.title: All Nations Baptist Church (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that All Nations Baptist Church in New York City is primarily associated with ethnic Koreans of the former Soviet Union?

elements.title: TikTok-A-Thon for Trans Healthcare (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that home repair and maintenance educator Mercury Stardust and her friend Jory Vizcaino have raised more than $4 million for transgender healthcare through their TikTok-A-Thon for Trans Healthcare?

elements.title: Mew (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the promotion and hype around obtaining Mew in the original Pokémon games resulted in the games' sales increasing more than threefold?

elements.title: zombie-like obedience (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that zombie-like obedience has been attributed to Jesuits, the military, and followers of totalitarian regimes?
